intro.text:
You step up on to the ottoman and jump to reach the first intact stair. You pull yourself up onto your torso and just barely manage to heave the rest of your body over the ledge.

The rest of the stairs are sturdy enough and you make your way up to the second floor.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~HOW TO PLAY~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

To interact with and navigate the world of the game, you must use a basic set of commands. These allow you to look at and pick up items, walk around, talk to characters and more. 

IMPORTANT: The game supports many unlisted natural language commands (like "play piano" or "drink water"). Feel free to experiment and see what works (sometimes, you will have to!) However, the following list of basic commands includes most of what you need to complete the game. 

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

***INTERACTIONS WITH ROOMS, OBJECTS, AND CHARACTERS***

"Look around" 
Tells you what's in the current room.

"Inventory"
Tells you what objects you are currently carrying.

"Look at _____" 

"Take/Pick up _____"

"Use _____"

"Use _____ with _____ " 
Combines objects together.

"Open _____" and "Close _____"

"Push _____" and "Pull _____"

***CONVERSATIONS***

"Talk to _____"

"List topics" 
After you've started a conversation with someone, view what topics are available to discuss. (If you get the response "You don't see that there" make sure you're actually in a converation. "Talk to" the character.)

"Ask about _____" 
After you've started a conversation, ask about specific topics available for that character.

"Goodbye" 
Ends a conversation you're having with a character. 

***BASIC NAVIGATION***

"Go North/South/West/East/Up/Down"
Navigate the game with these basic cardinal directions.

"List exits" 
Tells you what exits are available in the current room/scene.

***FAST TRAVEL***
 
After you've already visited a room, you can fast travel back at any point by simply saying: 
"Go to _____" – (e.g. "Go to the Living Room")

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PART I: THE NEXUS

Your eyes blink open as the world around you comes into focus. You are in a small sparsely decorated bedroom with an antique style reminiscent of a time you can't quite place. 

You don't know how you got here... The last thing you remember was sipping a cup of coffee in that old diner on the corner of Jackson Square. The flavor of its chicory spice still hangs on your tongue, yet it seems like it all happened a hundred years ago. 

There was a girl, she was in trouble... You search your memory for more detail, but the strain hurts your head. It is an odd sensation -- it's not that you can't remember, but rather your brain just can't be bothered to do it right now. 

You snap out of your reverie and notice the details of the room.
The candlelit bed chamber is small, but cozy.

east into a new room at the end of the hall

exits.text: to the west leading back to the hall of history

intro.text: You step onto a wide balcony. Looking out, you see a sky full of clouds, tinted a dark, unnatural purple hue. Rising in the distance you see a dim lighthouse, but beyond that you can't see any water on the horizon. In fact, you can't see much of anything. On the ground below the balcony, there is a stone patio beside a grassy lawn.

You step into the hidden passage and make your way down the stairs. As you descend, the light grows dimmer and dimmer -- a chill runs up the back of your spine. When you reach the bottom step, you can't see anything.

exits.text: up the curtain to the balcony

intro.text:
You climb down the curtain, scaling the side of the building -- your jacket billowing dramatically in the wind. 

The end of the curtain hovers a few feet off a stone patio. You leap down and look around:

The mansion towers imposingly next you. Its domed turrets and elaborately ornamented cornices and balustrades remind you of the Victorian style mansions in the garden district back in New Orleans.

sceneList.name: Base of the Lighthouse

exits.text: west along the path to the East Lawn
and up to the Lantern Room of the lighthouse

intro.text: You follow the path through a patch of trees and arrive at the base of a lighthouse.
You walk up north behind the mansion.
You walk to the lawn west of the mansion.

exits.text: down to the base of the lighthouse
west out to the exterior catwalk of the tower

intro.text: You swing back the door and head inside the lighthouse. After scaling the tower's long spiral staircase, you arrive inside the lighthouse's lantern room.

exits.text: to the east back to the lantern room

intro.text: You step out onto the metal catwalk that loops around the top of the lighthouse. A crisp breeze kisses your skin and the sky is filled with clouds tinted a strange purple hue.

You fly though the air at breakneck speeds until the cable gradually becomes less steep and dips enough to slow your descent. As you approach the mansion, your velocity slows and you manage to land on the rooftop with surprising grace.

sceneList.name: The Kennel House

intro.text:
You step into the old kennel house. Tumbleweeds of dog hair and piles of miscellaneous detritus pepper every surface. An unshaven mutt of a man shouts drunkenly from the corner:

"Ah! A fresh face! Come in lad, come in! Warm yourself by the fire and join an old kennel master for a drink!" He takes a long pull from a jar of some potent liquid you can smell from across the room. 

"I've gotten so sick of looking at the same goddamn faces. You know the problem with eternity? It never ends!"

topics.name: Archie
topics.script:
play("\"Oh, Archie is my fiancé. He gave me this beautiful ring here. But he's been missing for such a long time. Days, maybe even weeks. It's so hard to keep track of time in this place, but you'll find that out if you haven't already. I do miss him so. I hope he's all right – but he's got some serious explaining to do when he gets back!\"")
makeUnbroachable("maid", "Archie")

response.text: "My fiancé Archie gave it to me. Do you like it? Isn't it stunning? Sometimes when I'm waking up, the morning light hits it and it glitters like starlight. As long as I love my Archie, it will never leave my finger."

topics.name: this place
the master

response.text: The Master is...the Master. He's been here longer than any of us. He built this place -- Without him we wouldn't be here right now. Sure, it was hard when I first got here -- and he can be very cold. But that's just his way. When you meet him you'll understand. He'll be back any day now.

topics.script:
play("\"The Master is...the Master. He's been here longer than any of us. He built this place, brought us all here. Sure, it was hard at first – and he can be very cold. But that's just his way. When you meet him you'll understand. Hopefully he'll be back soon. The mansion tends to go to ruin when he's gone long.\"\n\n\*\*New Topic Added: \"Ruin?\"\*\*")

topics.script:
play("\"You know, things all just seem to blur together a bit here. It’s been the same ever since I arrived, whenever that was, but at least when I was cooking I had my craft to keep me grounded. The smells were pretty much all I had to stop from becoming adrift in the sea of monotony.\"")
makeUnbroachable("chef", "Memory")

topics.name: This place
The Master

response.text: "Well you must be new here if you haven’t met the Master. He’s a demanding fellow, with an impeccable taste for gourmet cooking. He found me some years ago and employed me as his private chef. Little did I know it would bring me here! Or that I would spend countless hours slaving away to cobble together culinary masterpieces from what meagre flora and fauna can be found this godforsaken place."

response.text: "Oh sure, I’ve thought about escape. We’ve all thought about it. But what good is thinking? Only the master knows. He always says if we want to leave it’s as easy as 1,2,3. His idea of a joke I guess."

response.text: "Yes...hmmm...the passcode. Funny thing. I can't remember it. Whenever Master wanted me to remember, he had me make the Eggs Benedict. The smell always jogged it back out of me. But then he'd take the recipe back, and I'd forget all over again."

response.text: "Yes. The wretch looks over the master's scent hounds. But I'm afraid the grounds are quite overhunted, and the idleness has driven the man into the bottom of a bottle. On a number of occasions he has behaved inappropriately around my dear fiancé, and a I daresay he is likely to go further, if he hasn't already! In fact, it wouldn't surprise me at all if my imprisonment is part of his muddleheaded scheme to snatch her away from me. You must help me, you must find the key and get me out of here!"

topics.name: key

response.text: "Yes, you know, the little metal thingy you put in door and twist. You have heard of doors haven't you? Or is that concept foreign to you as well?! Oh, I'm sorry if I'm being snippy, but I've been in here for ages and ages, you have to get me out! Find that mongrel Kennel Master, he's the key to finding...well. The key."

actions.script:
if (!getFlag("journal_study", "read")){
    play("You flip through the pages of the journal. Most of it is filled with a handwritten scrawl of indecipherable symbols, diagrams and strings of unknown characters. In the last few pages however, you discover an entry in perfectly readable english:

"It was sometime in the late 7th century that I happened upon these marvelous mahogany wood panels in a merchant’s trailer in the markets of Constantinople. Upon examination I was stunned to discover that its rich inlays depicted the legend of Tab and Zal – A tale that I had hoped had been long lost to the ravages of time. Apparently, not so." 

"The topmost panel shows the arrival of the gods Tab and Zab from beyond they sky to the people of ancient Sumer. Tab and Zal could not stay long on the land, for by nature they were transitory beings, but before they left, they prophesied a great calamity in man’s future, one that only they had the power to stem. 

"On the second panel, you can see the gods bestowing their knowledge to the village elders in the form of three magic runes, each with powers beyond imagining. The final piece features the villagers swearing oaths to safeguard the stones, and vowing to keep them forever hidden across the ages, so that one day Tab and Zal might return to help in the time of chaos."

 "Even though the carvings were hardly enough to betray all the details of the legend, there was no sense in risking that this forgotten chapter of history become public knowledge. So I stole them. And now I’ve had them repurposed as a rather regal door for my study. Still, the incident was a disquieting – who was this artist? How many more still remember? It is a question I intend to find the answer to."

You close the journal and put it back on the shelf.")

response.text: "Please deliver my gift to my fiancé as soon as possible!"

topics.name: maid_1

response.text:
"My darling Cosette! She must be beside herself with worry. I must see her at once."

The Butler starts for the door, but stops when he sees himself in the mirror. 

"Dear god, look at the state of me. I can't let her see me like this. Oh, but I must let her know I'm all right. I shall write to her."

He pulls a pen and paper from his jacket and begins writing.

"I'll also need to give her something, by way of apology for my long absence. Something beautiful. Do you have anything like that?"
"Before I can send her this letter, I'll need some sort of gift to include. Something beautiful. Do you have anything like that?"

"The Ki'udbah Alliga. From what I understand, it is some sort of ancient runestone. It allows one to traverse the timestream, like a sort of mystical passport. The Master had one – it was what allowed him to bring us all here. As long as he had the stone, he was able to enter the doors of time."

topics.name: this place
topics.script:
play("\"You are obviously new here, but undoubtedly you are already aware of the rather extraordinary nature of the Nexus. Having trouble remembering things? Does it seem like a certain something is missing from the world? What you are missing, my boy, is the tick of the minute hand. Don’t believe me? Look at a clock. This peculiarity is of the greatest interest to my master -- it is why our work here is so very important.\"\n \n\*\*New topic added: \"The Master's work?\"\*\*")
makeBroachable("freebutler", "his work")
makeUnbroachable("freebutler", "this place")

topics.name: his work
topics.script:
play("\"The Master is a scholar not of history, but of time itself. From what I understand this mansion exists in a nexus, a sort of inbetween point, or perhaps behind the curtain of time, as it were. This place is not only the object of his study, but a base of operations, from which he can travel to other periods as easily as you might board a train.\"")
makeUnbroachable("freebutler", "his work")

Aw, that old sweetie.\"\n\n She takes the note and reads it:\n\n \"\'How I came by the misfortune of being stuck in this infernal place with a mongrel like you is beyond me. It\'s bad enough that you constantly smell of dog, but even your very face reminds one of that hateful canine race. And yet, it is hardly a surprise as you are the leader of all bitches. You are a truly disgusting excuse for a human being, and it would be my greatest pleasure to never encounter you, or your stench again. With deepest rancor, Archibald E. Thunker\'\"\n\n Her face turns a scarlet red and she tears up the note and throws the followers against the wall.\n\n\"That. BASTARD. No one speaks to me that way! NO ONE! And they certainly don\'t MARRY me!!\"\n\n She twists the diamond ring off her finger and tosses it against the wall as she storms out the room.")

response.text:
**TAPE RECORDER SFX**

KINDRA: "Hey, Kindra, it’s Kindra. Found this old tape recorder tucked away in Father’s study.  Figure maybe it can help with our memory if we start keeping a little voice diary. So, you know, don’t forget to keep up with, okay? Also, don’t tell father about this. He doesn’t like me messing with temporal artifacts, so it’s our little secret. He’s gone again today. He's been gone for awhile this time. Maybe in Europe again. Hope he comes back soon, the house is really starting to fall apart. In his absence, I’ve taken to walking the grounds. Yesterday I tried to solve the hedge maze, but nothing made any sense to me. I know there’s some trick to it, but it’s hard to run an empirical study when you can barely even remember what you had breakfast. Tonight I think I’ll go up the lighthouse and watch the stars flickering over the edge of the world. I like looking at them – it’s peaceful. It almost feels like I’m somewhere else. "

If I fail, you have to help me remember. Whatever happens he’s got to be stopped, what he’s planning–"

\*\*A MUFFED NOISE & FOOTSTEPS\*\*

 KINDRA: \”Coming father! Wish me luck.\”

\*\*SOUND OF TAPE REACHING END\*\*")

I’m in a world made of metal buildings, towering straight up into the clouds – there are streets crowded with strange looking people. Electric lights and sounds fill the air, and in the moment it is so vivid...so foreign, yet familiar.  I recognize words - the names of places and things.  I see machines made of pure, suspended light. Father, says it’s the future I’m seeing – the visions, another side effect of living here in liminal space. It’s all so real, so...present. If that’s the future, how do I know that now...is even now? Ugh, I hate this place.\"\n\nYou stash the tape in your inventory.")

There is something tucked away in the corners of my mind but he refuses to help me access it.  And why is his memory so much better than ours? Is it because he spends such much time outside of the Nexus, in real time? What if I could just get closer to the temporal barrier?  Maybe then I would start to remember – I don't know…but I have to try it. If he won’t show me where he keeps the doors of time, I’ll have to find it myself. \"\n\nYou stash the tape in your inventory.")

Thank god for Archie, he’s the only one that really seems to care about getting out of this place, about having a future, any future. This morning I asked father: if the Nexus is so bad for my mind, then why don’t we just leave? But he says it’s not safe for me out there in the non-liminal, not until he finishes his research – and that what he’s doing will help me – help everyone! I don’t know what he means by that.  Okay, remember, tomorrow you’re supposed to help pick out a gift for Cosette. Something pretty, I think.  \"\n\nYou stash the tape in your inventory.")

Is this the first time I’ve learned the truth? That he’s not my father but my kidnapper? That I have been kept here not against my will, but against my very self! My identity! The time door seems to emanate pulses of linear energy, the nearer I approached it, the more my memories returned in jolting waves of clarity. Staring into the vortex, I could see the future...my past. I could see my team unearthing the stone from its millennia-old resting place, its runic symbols radiant with the unclassifiable, space-distorting energy our LIGO had detected. Years and years of testing and obsessive experimentation, and finally that last night. The one that opened the door for him. He can’t know that I’ve found out, but I can’t afford to wait until I forget again. I must find and activate the rune, it’s the only safe way through the time rift.\"\n\nYou stash the tape in your inventory.")

help.text:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~HOW TO PLAY~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

To interact with and navigate the world of the game, you must use a basic set of commands. These allow you to look at and pick up items, walk around, talk to characters and more. 

IMPORTANT: The game supports many unlisted natural language commands (like "play piano" or "drink water"). Feel free to experiment and see what works (sometimes, you will have to!) However, the following list of basic commands includes most of what you need to complete the game. 

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

***INTERACTIONS WITH ROOMS, OBJECTS, AND CHARACTERS***

"Look around" 
Tells you what's in the current room.

"Inventory"
Tells you what objects you are currently carrying.

"Look at _____" 

"Take/Pick up _____"

"Use _____"

"Use _____ with _____ " 
Combines objects together.

"Open _____" and "Close _____"

"Push _____" and "Pull _____"

***CONVERSATIONS***

"Talk to _____"

"List topics" 
After you've started a conversation with someone, view what topics are available to discuss. (If you get the response "You don't see that there" make sure you're actually in a converation. "Talk to" the character.)

"Ask about _____" 
After you've started a conversation, ask about specific topics available for that character.

"Goodbye" 
Ends conversation you're having with a character. 

***BASIC NAVIGATION***

"Go North/South/West/East/Up/Down"
Navigate the game with these basic cardinal directions.

"List exits" 
Tells you what exits are available in the current room/scene.

***FAST TRAVEL***
 
After you've already visited a room, you can fast travel back at any point by simply saying: 
"Go to _____" – (e.g. "Go to the Living Room")

!!!!SAY "HELP" TO SEE THESE COMMANDS AGAIN!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
